definition: face-to-face meeting/an interview
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
surname Tan

sentences.english: Take advantage of exit interviews, and diplomatically explain your stance.
sentences.chinese: 好好利用告别的面谈，婉转的解释你的立场。

sentences.english: He needed some Dutch courage before facing his boss about the pay increase.
sentences.chinese: 他需要喝点酒壮壮胆，才能当老板的面谈加薪的事。

sentences.english: The matter can not be discussed except at a personal interview.
sentences.chinese: 这件事只能在面谈时讨论。

sentences.english: Add a new interview result document for this change.
sentences.chinese: 为这项变更添加一个新的面谈结果文件。

sentences.english: HR manager and i have appointed to a interview at tomorrow morning.
sentences.chinese: 人事处经理与我约定明天上午面谈。

sentences.english: We would like to discuss the duration of the contract with you at the interview.
sentences.chinese: 面谈时我们再和您商洽契约的期限。

sentences.english: She was jumpy during her job interview because she was so nervous.
sentences.chinese: 她在应征面谈的时候心惊肉跳，因为她太紧张了。

sentences.english: Jacobs would like to set up an interview for early next week.
sentences.chinese: 雅可布先生想在下周早些时候约你面谈一次。

sentences.english: During the fair, different forms of interviews will be staged.
sentences.chinese: 在活动周期间将举行多种形式的面谈。

sentences.english: Normally applicants can get an interview within one or two weeks.
sentences.chinese: 通常，签证申请人可在一两周内就获面谈。

sentences.english: Mr Jackey would like to set an interview for earlier next week.
sentences.chinese: 雅可布先生想在下周早些时候约你面谈一次。

sentences.english: Walk over and talk to him.
At this time, yellow to porch call to let the son restaurant interview.
sentences.chinese: 此时，黄以轩打来电话让儿子来餐厅面谈。

sentences.english: Would you allow me _ to talk about my personal circs _?
sentences.chinese: 您可否让我跟您面谈我的个人情况呢？

sentences.english: I always get the collywobbles before an interview.
sentences.chinese: 我在面谈前总心神不宁。

sentences.english: But as you know，we have dozens of applicants to be answered.
sentences.chinese: 但你也知道，我们还有几个应征者要面谈。

definition: to be interviewed (as a candidate)/interview
to arrange an interview/an appointment (with the foreign ambassador)
to meet with/meeting
to have an in depth conversation/to have intimate talks/to discuss thoroughly
to talk (with sb)/to have a conversation/talk/conversation/CL:次[ci4]
to accept a job offer/to apply for an advertised position
person taking a job/job applicant/CL:位[wei4]
to discuss
to discuss a matter with sb/to get in touch with/to arrange
to confer/to discuss/to engage in talks
recommendation letter
variant of 開誠布公|开诚布公[kai1 cheng2 bu4 gong1]
lit. deal sincerely and fairly (idiom); frank and open-minded/plain speaking/Let's talk frankly and openly between ourselves./to put one's cards on the table
to parley/to negotiate/to discuss
to invite applications for a job/to recruit
prospective employer/person advertising a job/recruiter
written examination/paper test (for an applicant)
